image.altText: man in a suit next to a woman in red jacket and a younger man in a black shirt casting their vote

props.synopsis: The voting has closed, the counting begins on the Australian federal election. Follow live.

title.children: First polls close, counting begins in eastern states

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Reduced to its simplest form, the jury in Erin Patterson's trial will have to decide whether a beef Wellington cooked in her kitchen represents a terrible accident, or the ultimate act of betrayal.

title.children: Were Erin Patterson's deadly beef Wellingtons a terrible accident or murder?

image.altText: A composite photo showing two women and a man, with a sheep in front of them

props.synopsis: The ABC asked every Australian politician if they wore wool on the campaign trail.

title.children: Which politicians are wearing Aussie wool as industry pleads for help?

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a road.

props.synopsis: Brittany McDermott first saw the woman she will vote for on election day on a panel alongside politicians from the two major parties.

title.children: How everyday Australians told us they were planning to vote today

image.altText: Photos posted on a graffitied wall are spraypainted with words in red that say "war on men"

props.synopsis: The Melbourne mural depicting female victims of alleged violence was spray-painted with the words "war on men".

title.children: Femicide Watch founder describes memorial graffiti as 'soul-destroying'

image.altText: Man in grey shift with moustache and black rimmed glasses in a hospital bed with left hand bandaged and in a sling.

props.synopsis: Vince Manuel will live with permanent damage to his hand after a loose dog attacked him while he was walking his Labrador and "sausage dog" in a Victorian town.

title.children: Walker suffers lifelong injury protecting his pets from dog attack

image.altText: Ben Keays gets bumped by an opponent just after kicking the ball

props.synopsis: The Western Bulldogs demolish Port Adelaide in a one-sided encounter in Ballarat, while Adelaide prepares to host Carlton. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Crows in control against Blues in Adelaide, Bulldogs complete demolition of Power

image.altText: Martin Grant stands in a room with fashion posters on the wall, surrounded by mannequins with red shirts and dresses.

props.synopsis: From designing his first clothes as a teenager in Melbourne to the runways of Paris with celebrities, Martin Grant has had a full career — and it's not over yet.

title.children: He's dressed Cate Blanchett and Lady Gaga, and is still making fashion waves

image.altText: Virginia Trioli Osaka photo 2 Umekita Park

props.synopsis: On a recent trip to Japan I went in search of what had been described to me as a near perfect example of an urban green development in one of the most green-starved cities in the world.

title.children: A visit to a park in Osaka made me dream big for Australia's green spaces

image.altText: A corner pub bearing the name and image of a Nationals candidate.

props.synopsis: A publican's push to wrest the seat of Bendigo from Labor is in full swing, but despite an apparent "tidal wave" of cash and blanket advertising, he has his work cut out for him.

title.children: This guy is 'everywhere' but is it enough to swing a safe Labor seat?

image.altText: A crashed helicopter in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Three people suffered serious injuries when their helicopter crashed in water between Point Lonsdale and Ocean Grove on Victoria's Bellarine Peninsula.

title.children: Three people survive helicopter crash near Geelong

image.altText: A historic-looking brick building in the countryside.

props.synopsis: The Old Castlemaine Gaol in Central Victoria has been purchased by an alternative education provider and will become a secondary school.

title.children: Heritage-listed Castlemaine prison building to become independent school

image.altText: Justin Longmuir looks to his right during a Dockers AFL match.

props.synopsis: Justin Longmuir admits he and his players will be forced to do some soul searching after the humiliating 61-point thrashing handed out by the Saints on Friday night.

title.children: 'What did I get wrong?' Dockers coach Longmuir left searching for answers

props.synopsis: Wills was Labor heartland, but now the seat that belonged to Bob Hawke is squarely in the marginal column.

title.children: Why Melbourne’s inner north has Labor worried

image.altText: Two police stand in front of a large group of Mongols motorcycle riders

props.synopsis: Police in NSW and Victoria have arrested 29 people while targeting organised crime and outlaw motorcycle gangs.

title.children: NSW and Victorian police target bikie gangs in border blitz

image.altText: Selfie of 16-year-old Pasawm Lyhym.

props.synopsis: A teenager who stabbed and killed a 16-year-old boy near a bus interchange in Melbourne's west two years ago will spend at least eight years behind bars.

title.children: Teen jailed over train station stabbing 'genuinely remorseful'

image.altText: Lawyer Joseph Acquaro outside the court.

props.synopsis: Authorities have abandoned the prosecution of the man accused of murdering Melbourne gangland lawyer Joseph “Pino” Acquaro, who was shot dead outside his gelato shop in 2016.

title.children: Charges dropped over gangland lawyer's murder

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A woman who stopped to help five teenagers after they crashed on a Melbourne freeway has been set upon and had her car stolen.

title.children: Woman has car stolen on freeway after stopping to help at crash

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's estranged husband tells her triple-murder trial his wife had sent "inflammatory messages" to a family group chat and was being "extremely aggressive", months before a deadly family lunch.

title.children: Erin Patterson sent 'extremely aggressive' texts to estranged husband, court hears

image.altText: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan playing for the Western Bulldogs against the Sydney Swans.

props.synopsis: Bulldogs coach Luke Beveridge won't buy into speculation Jamarra Ugle-Hagan might not be seen at AFL level again after the forward took leave from the club.

title.children: 'Let's move beyond it': Bulldogs' Beveridge not focusing on Ugle-Hagan

image.altText: Two police stand in front of a large group of Mongols motorcycle riders

props.synopsis: Police in NSW and Victoria have arrested 29 people while targeting organised crime and outlaw motorcycle gangs.

title.children: NSW and Victorian police target bikie gangs in border blitz

image.altText: Two Victoria Police vehicles on the road.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after antisemitic flyers authorised by neo-Nazis were distributed to Jewish households in Melbourne.

title.children: Neo-Nazi flyers delivered to Jewish households in Melbourne

image.altText: Adrian Portelli holds several 100 dollar bills in his hand

props.synopsis: The property investor and social media influencer will stand trial in an Adelaide court later this year after pleading not guilty to several charges of conducting an unlawful lottery.

title.children: Adrian Portelli ordered to stand trial over unlawful lottery allegations

image.altText: A man wearing a black baseball cap and black and white checked shirt stands in the middle of a resident street.

props.synopsis: Camberwell is one of the first areas to witness the way the Victorian government's new housing development plan is playing out on established neighbourhoods, heritage protections and property prices.

title.children: Amid zoning changes, long-term residents plan their exit from Camberwell

image.altText: Monash independent candidate Deb Leonard.

props.synopsis: A Liberal stronghold is under pressure in Victoria as a veteran MP turns independent and a Climate 200-backed challenger looms with a well-resourced grassroots campaign.

title.children: Could the seat of Monash be set for an independent upset?

image.altText: A man in a grey polo shirt stands in a green field under a blue sky.

props.synopsis: A south-west Victorian farmer has been found guilty of destroying an ancient Aboriginal rock formation on his property in 2021.

title.children: Court finds farmer guilty of destroying Aboriginal cultural heritage

image.altText: A man stands with his hands in his pockets in front of a large tractor on a farm, with sheep eating hay in background

props.synopsis: Steve Wheeler has had 1,700 sheep stolen in three incidents over two years. Police suspect he has become the victim of a series of targeted raids.

title.children: Victorian farmer target of 'coordinated' sheep heist costing him $175k

image.altText: Alastair Clarkson looks over his shoulder during the Kangaroos vs Bombers match.

props.synopsis: North Melbourne coach Alastair Clarkson questions the AFL's decision to suspend Paul Curtis for three matches after the Kangaroos record a sixth straight defeat.

title.children: Clarkson hits out at AFL over Curtis ban after Roos' loss to Bombers

image.altText: Monique Ryan Amelia Hamer pre-poll signs

props.synopsis: Liberals say the Boroondara City Council threatened Amelia Hamer's implied constitutional freedom of political communication when it took down her signs.

title.children: Kooyong corflute kerfuffle headed for court as Liberals cry foul at council

image.altText: A man with stubble and grey hair films a video on social media

props.synopsis: Brian Barnes faces court over an alleged assault while in custody, with prosecutors applying for access to body-worn camera and CCTV footage.

title.children: Man accused of murdering former teacher faces court on assault charges

image.altText: Pedestrians shelter from rain under umbrellas in a wet city.

props.synopsis: A run of showery and stormy days is soaking Australia's east coast, while a record drought across South Australia and Victoria continues to intensify.

title.children: A wind deviation responsible for SA, Victoria drought and the NSW soaking

image.altText: A picture of St Kilda AFL coach Ross Lyon standing on the sidelines at Docklands looking out on the field during a match.

props.synopsis: Ross Lyon hits out at the VFL after Alix Tauru was suspended for four weeks before a two week bye.

title.children: Saints coach 'absolutely filthy' about rookie's suspension, takes aim at VFL

image.altText: Corella dead on Wimmera riverfront

props.synopsis: Agriculture Victoria and the Conservation Regulator are investigating, after the council said the incident at Horsham appeared to be the result of illegal poisoning.

title.children: Dozens of dead birds found by river in case of suspected poisoning
